title: Problem going there, great coming back
review: Going to Xian was on a small plane. Think there was only 8 seats in Business Class. There was a problem with the plane and we had to get off the plane after everyone had boarded and then wait for about 30 min in the terminal before reboarding everyone again. Flight was short (3 hrs). Service was OK, but not great.

title: Irresponsible for customer service
review: This is a dragon air fraud case. They have told us before issuing the tkt. that they will provide the Lounge. When confirmed in system the Nepal counter office told us this system is confirmed this print is valid. When checked in Canada Toronto counter they also told that they will provide lunch only. But in nepal told lunch with good sleeping chair. We told okay. But in the hong kong they did not provide even a bottle of water . Lunch and relaxed chair is far behind their promise. Who is responsible for 14 hrs long transit's with out a single support is of their irresponsible service and not sincere the customer.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Good aircrafts not so good service
review: I flew from KUL to Beijing and back on Cathay Dragon few days back. The planes were relatively new with ample amount of leg space in economy and a fair selection of titles in its entertainment systems. The check-in was smooth. However the flights were delayed, the stewardesses kept forgetting the requests for drinks/blankets that too not in one of those segments but on 2 separate flights in this journey. The planes were clean and the toilets had hand and face creams which we don't generally see in most of the other carriers.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: How dragons fall
review: Mostly old aircraft. Used to think only India sector was bad but no better from Hong Kong only.

title: The first flight with Cathay Dragon that was disappointing
review: I use this flight as a connecting flight from Jakarta to Shanghai with flight number Hongkong-Shanghai (CX5890) and Shanghai-Hongkong (CX5805). The flight with Cathay Pacific is no problem. However flights with Cathay Dragon from Hongkong-Shanghai and Shanghai-Hongkong both experienced delays. The most annoying thing was the trip from Shanghai-Hongkong which was delayed up to 1 hour, while I still had to transfer to Jakarta, which resulted in me having to run around upon arrival at Hongkong airport to get to the gate destined for flight to Jakarta. For food on flight from Hongkong-Shanghai, it is unfortunate that there is no food menu other than a menu containing pork. Finally I got a menu of tuna sandwhich. While the food menu while traveling Shanghai-Hongkong is quite tasty in the sense that there is no problem. It's just that my chair can not be adjusted to more lean, because there is a problem with the button. What an experience that should be fun, becomes an upsetting experience.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: HKG lounge experience was excellent! Flight so so.
review: I like the first class lounges in Hong Kong! At this time I stayed at The Pier close to gate 62. The lounge is well designed and I could relax in between two flights. I also received a 15 minutes shoulder massage and a refreshing shower afterwards. The beverage selection is quite ok, but I was not convinced completely of the taste of the food items. In the really nicely designed à la carte restaurant the staff was very attentive, but the food I had was tasteless! I‘m sorry to admit that... After boarding the flight I was greeted by the flight attendants and I settled down in my seat 1A. This is a single seat at the window in their A330-300 and was quite nice to sit at. Unfortunately Cathay Dragon doesn‘t offer many inflight amenities on a 3,5 h First class flight like slippers or so. The food was nothing special at all. The flight has been on time ans I felt save at all times onboard their plane!

title: Budget airline at premium price
review: As a steadfast fan of CX despite its ongoing decline, I am always hugely disappointed with Cathay Dragon. The whole experience is that of a budget airline — the worst gates (often a bus ride to/from the terminal), terrible service, horrible food, old aircrafts. I wouldn’t mind if I was paying budget airline fees but it’s the cost of CX with none of the upside.

title: Delayed flight, mad dash in Hong Kong
review: All in all I had a pleasant flight with good service. THe food is okay. My flight had a 50 minute delay which meant the connection to CX0271 was going to be very tight. I do not like Hong Kong's airport it is too big and what I REALLY do not like is that arriving passengers who are tranisting must go for security before going to the gate areas for their continuing flights. In the case of delays like ours, this means extra time. They also parked away from the terminal and had to bus us in, and the buses were not waiting for us, and they wasted time letting peole take pictures in front of the plane, delaying us further. We made the next flight with 2 minutes to spare after a mad dash through the airport...

title: Good Except Hong Kong Satellite Terminal
review: Dragonair, operated by Cathay Pacific, is ok in most aspects for flights going out of Hong Kong except one must take a shuttle bus to a satellite terminal to board the plane which requires extra time to reach the boarding gate and must walk up a flight of stairs to board the airplane. Upon landing, one must also carry his carry-on luggage and walk down the same stairs to board a shuttle bus to the main terminal. For those that have walking issues or have issues with their carry-on luggage, this becomes a pretty difficult task. I have seen a handicap passenger literally must be physically carried off the plane to get to the bottom of the stairs to board the shuttle bus. other than that, it's pretty much in line with Cathay Pacific flights...

title: Outstanding
review: I travel this sector average twice a month and I dont have much choice because China Airlines or Mandarin Airlines always give me surprise whenever I flew with them. The reason why I choose KA is becoz of their frequency. I hv no expectation on KA inflight service at all because it is not like the KA that I used to fly. But when I flew to HK on March 10. A flight attendant name Eleni was very cheerful and I saw her helped some old ladies to lift their carryon items to the overhead compartment. She was so patient on explaining to a passenger on the emergency exit row not to hv any items in front of the seat. Her Mandarin was extraordinary good compare with other KA flight attendants. She served me the inflight meal with a warm smile and not like other KA flight that I took the flight attendants was so cold when they were serving us. I always think maybe I am on coach class and not sitting at the front thats why I received poor service. But Ms. Eleni made me change my mind and I hope to see her again on my next journey to HK again.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: no ventilation for 45 minutes in a packed plane - stuffy and hot, about to pass out!!!
review: I have marco polo memebership so I boarded the plane very early, after everyone has boarded, the captain announced that there would be a short delay due to problem with the plane, we waited and waited, there was no ventilation on the plane, only stale air. The cabin got hotter and stuffier. At that point all the passengers have their fan out. It was very uncomfortable and felt like an airtight space, I started having problem breathing and I asked the air hostess to turn on some ventilation or tell us how long we had to wait, she said it was out of her control, and walked away, and never came back. The situation lasted another 15 minutes after the plane is fixed and ventilation back on. It really was one of my worst experience I had!!!!!

title: Dragonair priced like Cathay, offers mostly budget perks.
review: Posing as Cathay on your ticket, Dragonair is no more then a glorified budget plane. No in-flight entertainment system. The plane type and seat size are identical to my out-going VietjetAir flight that only was half the price. The cabin merely looks like a Cathay plane, but once seated the VJA memories are there to remind you that you just wasted a lot of money, simply for a better time-slot, and THAT they offer. Beats waiting in transit with 2 kids and a wife till 0100AM for a 90 minute flight home. Would recommend it, albeit disgruntled. Food was below average, but at least it was vegetarian. They deserve points for that one, these days.

review: I wass supposed to fly from Siem Reap to Hong Kong on a thursday. Wednesday morning, I received an email from my agent indicating that the flight had been chnged to that morning, moved ahead by a full day. I scrambled to get to the airport and made it to Hong Kong a day ahead of my connectinig flight to North America.

title: Going Business class is a must for this airline because.....
review: Going Cathay Business class (Dragon- my year in China) is a must for this airline because they take care of your needs while on and during your flight! I suggest trying the many lounge selections at the airport at various levels. Meals were delicious and stewardess very cordial before during and after the flight.

title: Definitely better than a budget airline
review: Flew for the first time with Cathay Dragon from Hong Kong to Siem Riep. The service was good the seats quite comfortable considering I am reasonable size. The inflight meal that wasn’t listed (the flight was listed as just refreshments) was really good. Seafood and potatoes. Yummy.

title: ok for short hop
review: ok for the short hop to hong kong , standard small plane nothing good or bad just normal short haul plane

title: Short Flight specialist
review: Its not my first time to take KA flgihts, and its the second time I took KA between Hong Kong and Kaohsiung. Just an hour flying time, but the efficient cabin crews did all the stuff in a regular flight, meals, duty free, entertainment .... The departure and arrival times were all on schedule which were very good. Also, the arrangement for boarding is good too, though this flight was a A330, it wasn't made up to a messy at the gate. But one thing was that for the trip from Hong Kong to Kaohisung, it was a A320, the in-flight entertainment was through the app StudioKA downloaded with the connnection to the wifi but I just cannot make it for the whole flight.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Not a lot of legroom but a meal on a short flight, what a surprise
review: I "paid" for this flight with business class miles but had to sit in Economy because there were no business class seats available. The flight departure and arrival times were perfect so I took the downgrade. I selected my seat on line but when I got the counter at the airport I asked if they had anything closer to the front and the agent put me in a middle seat. I told him what would not do so the only seat I could then get was next to the last row on the plane in the aisle. Although the seat was very small and there was not a lot of leg room they actually served a meal on this 2 1/2 hour flight. And it was not bad. I had the sweet and sour chicken with rice meal which came with a fruit cup, water and a cookie. Pretty good for such a short flight. My flight attendant told me all of the Asian flights serve a meal, even in Economy. What a pleasant surprise. The flight attendants were very nice and professional.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Worst food ever
review: On 1 hr .45 flight to Hong Kong. I’ve been flying many decades and eaten plastic airline food but I would like to award the airline the worst food ever - and that’s saying something!

title: Very Good
review: This flight was very convenient and comfortable. I was happy to be able to check in and check our baggage all the way through to Cebu in the Philippines, our final destination. This enabled us to have a pleasant overnight stop in Hong Kong and present ourselves at the departure gate the following morning. We travelled at the beginning of the Chinese New Year holiday and more could have been done to minimise the time in lines for checking in. The flight itself, once boarded was great enjoyable food and I found some very enjoyable diversionary stuff on the entertainment console.

Hong Kong airport is huge and our flight went from satellite terminal requiring a bus -- this took time.

review: Uneventful flight. Left a bit late and arrived in Kathmandu about 40 mins late. Food was good. Service was good as well. TV I had kept freezing and needing to reset itself which was annoying (Seat 29D). Took me forever to watch one movie. Flight was about 5hrs and 10 mins.

title: Thank you to the staff at check in counter
review: We arrived at check in counter at only 50 mins before departure. And actually the gate was already closed. Since we were a group of 3 Diamond Members and 1 Gold Member, the staff decided to reopen the gate to check us in for the flight and our check in luggage. So, finally we made it and could reach home early. Thank you. In flight experience and services were all good.

title: My first time to land at Hongqiao instead of Pu Dong Airport
review: It is a good and comfortable flight. I usually go to Shanghai via Pu Dong Airport. This is my first time to try landing at Hongqiao Airport. Overall, a good experience on this flight. And most important, no delay on the flight! Thank you

There are many expats working in BJ and HK.

title: Not more than ok
review: The flight left and arrived on time. Ok seats and ok inflight entertainment. The cabin crew was nice but mealservice awful. I saw the crew do their best but it was not easy with all the complaint about the food and drink from the passengers. On my way home I will grab something to eat to take with me.

title: Average flight
review: The fare was cheap, aircraft comfortable and check-in at the KL Sentral city terminal was great. The crew were professional but average. Not outstanding at all. The worst part of the flight was the meal. The noodles were overheated until it became a mushy sticky clump. The vegetable was almost brown from the overheating. The other choice was just as bad. My travel companion described the baked bean as "baby food" like. At the departure lounge the passenger were separated based on the seat location, but when boarding began, those seated in the forward of the economy were released first which resulted in a mess in the cabin.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Absolute discomfort!
review: Passengers are crammed more tightly than in domestic flights. You do not need to get into the brace position for emergencies, since you are always sitting in the brace position due to the abject lack of leg room. The sore back you get will make you remember this flight for long...!

The cabin crew were rude and were not helpful at all. They were really bossy and it seems like they were not enjoying their job and would not smile. I would not fly with them again.

However, on my way back, there was no inflight entertainment and the aircraft was smaller so the flight was extremely full. Nonetheless, they are alright!

title: Perfect Flight

title: This flight was just do it
review: We wanted to the temples out of Hong kong. Only flight was Cathay Dragon.

title: Racist Chinese Crew
review: If you have a US visa or other rich country visa then they will serve you a special meal like a proper human meal. But like me with a filipino visa, they only serve chicken adobo sandwich and they just hand it over to you like they are feeding prisoners in prison. Dont get me wrong, the adobo was good, all Im trying to say is, can't we filipino eat what other visa holder eat? Does our ticket costs less?
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Business class not worth the money
review: Very small business class. Poorly reclining seats. iPads issued for entertainment, I already had my own, thank you. Food mediocre. I could have flown economy and been just as fine without the premium paid for business. Not worth the price. Sorry.

title: Reliable service but slightly tired seats and planes
review: I like Cathay Pacific - their lounger services in Hong Kong are just excellent and serve some of the best lounge food ever. I flew from Bangalore to HK on Cathay Dragon and you get excellent service, good food and very good pilots - however- the seats were quite old and didnt lay flat which meant that sleep was difficult. Given that the flight was 6 hours and we left at midnight it was dissapointing
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Service not consistent, meal choice needs improvement, cabin condition can be better
review: I have been flying Dragon air and now Cathay Dragon for many years as this is company approved airline every month. The inflight service has not been consistent. Some flight stewardess has been walking around within the cabin providing assistance throughout the flight. But compared to other Asia airline such as SIA, found many times just chitchatting at the area center or back of the cabin despite this is just three hours flight and the flight is completely full in economy class. Other airlines’ would proactively serve water before or after meals or just walking around to ensure needs are taken cared of proactively. The meals portion is less than others’ too and the vegetarian menu has been the same for years. While the seats are totally sold off, the cabin is always congested, please make our journey more comfortable.

title: Great flight
review: We used this airline as a connecting flight from Hong Kong to Kuala Lumpur the aircraft was very comfortable with good leg room the service was excellent inflight meal very good using airline again for return to HK

title: Dim sum served
review: On time ,good leg space , only 1:30 hour flight,they served DIm sum set which was very delicious I like it,

title: Smooth move, no problems
review: Really good for a the budget airline of its bigger brother Cathay Pacific.

title: Boarding crew are impossible
review: We encountered a problem during our connecting flight to Shanghai and we are asking the assistance of the boarding crew in Hongkong so that we could make it to the aircraft on time. Rather than assist us, they made us wait and made us repeat the problem several times to different staff. Finally, they told us after that they cannot do anything about the problem and the airplane will just leave us. They made us wait for those precious time without any solution! They said that they will assist us once the plane takes off so we just made a solution ourselves rather than wait for them for nothing. Luckily the flight was delayed so we were able to board on the same flight after asking them if we can still board the same plane since it has not left yet.

title: Poor Airline
review: I have the flight travelled on 28/12/2017. That was the last flight from KHH to HKG. Originally, the flight would depart around 21:30, but it delayed, as we could only be boarded the flight near 22:00, and departed around 22:30. Owing to the delay, we arrived Hongkong at the Mid-night, without Airport bus, without Airport Express Railway, without MTR.

scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Poor Customer Service & overall flight Experience
review: As a frequent flyer, I'm a big fan of budget airlines as they provide a purpose - cheap and cheerful! But a recent journey with Cathay Dragon made me reconsider paying less. From their poor catering, to their unengaging staff they won't be winning any awards for Customer Service. The food menu really needs to be address and upgraded as it's honestly worse than hospital food. Plain choices and miserable portion size left us and fellow passengers we spoke with disappointed and hungry. Our flight on the way back from Phnom Penh was due to take flight at 7.05pm and yet we standing in the boarding queue for 40 mins and not one member of staff had the courtesy to announce its delay. Instead left us standing Infront of them clearly irritable and looking for answers. They didn't announce a delay on the screen just left it at the original flight time. Really poor service and won't be flying with them again.

title: A touch above the rest
review: A truly pleasant surprise.

title: a short hop to final destination
review: very nice flight staff attentive food not very good seating was ok with good legroom required the meet and assist on return flight due to short time between flights this was handled expertly and took all the stress away getting to connecting flight which we would never have made on time if we were looking for ourselves hong kong is a BIG airport we needed to catch train from landing point to departure point this is where the meet and assist is helpful congrats to all staff at cathay pacific and cathay dragon you made our journey pleasent

title: Smooth flight
review: This is another 5star airline for me. Service crew are very accommodating, food served hot and tastes good. Flight was right on time, economy seats have sufficient leg room.

title: Lousy entertainment App damages Cathay brand
review: As a frequent Cathay flier I have often chosen it over other airlines even if it is pricier, partly because of its excellent in-flight entertainment. This was our first experience of one of its flights where you have to use its app on your own device to watch movies and a) it should be made crystal clear to travelers that this is the case (we had no idea until we were on board) b) they must fix the app so that it gets a better rating than 1.7/5 on Google Play. Until they do the latter, unless they slash their prices, fly budget for this sector. Also, while Cathay has some good lounges for its frequent fliers, the one in Kota Kinabalu was worse than the Plaza Premium one.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Very Disappointed
review: Surprisingly Disappointing, Cathay has not maintained its high world class quality.... flight and food were average but when we landed in Jakarta it took over an hour for our luggage to arrive and that after being bumped from one carousel to another. Three or four other flights arrived before or at the same time as us and all passengers from those left with their luggage. We were the only ones waiting. Do not want to fly Cathay for some time.

title: Punctual, comfortable, even food on a short haul
review: Easy check in, comportable plane, on time. Only a short flight but still served food, a sort of meat chinese roll, coffee or sweet tea (no choice, already sweetened). Friendly crew that spoke English. Speedy loading and unloaded. No complaints. Thinking about the food service was exceptional as we were up and down in under an hour and it was a large aircraft, sorry can't remember what it was.

title: Service is getting worse and worse
review: Being a gold member of the Marco Polo club for many many years, I have been flying on Cathay Pacific and Cathay Dragon quite frequently. Unfortunately I also witnessed how the services have been deteriorating. I remember the flight attendant used to come and greet the members but nowadays they do not even bother doing that. And this is not only happening on this flight, but consistently throughout the last year. Not sure whether there are simply too many gold members for them to care?

title: An uncomfortable flight
review: I took this flight from Penang to Hong Kong mainly because it was the only direct flight between the two destinations.

title: Best Business Direct Route
review: I recently had to travel and tried out Cathay Dragon via Hong Kong to Singapore; not too bad you take an A320 first then connect (less than 1 hour) via a 777; food is good and journey short (in Singapore by midnight); food quality needs improving on the Zhengzhou to Hong Kong flight however I recommend it to anyone going to Singapore from Zhengzhou.

title: Good service, old aircraft
review: They have attentive staffs, good food even for a short trip and comfortable seats. The only issue is that the aircraft looks old, not sure if it's the plug or the headset is not working.

Even though this was a rather short flight (less than three hours), we were served a very nice meal, and the inflight entertainment was superb. Cabin crew were very friendly, cheerful and helpful. I cannot really comment on "value for money" as we paid an all-inclusive rate for the whole four week tour. On the whole, a very pleasant experience. We could not ask for more.

title: Great service
review: I used cathay dragon for going Hong Kong to stay two nights. My flight from Shanghai to Hong Kong was at 8 PM. Therefore, I was worried that the flight delay. This is because so many flights delay in Shanghai. However, it hadn't been late. Also, eventhough we were 20 people of group, we could finish our check in in 20 minutes. The atitude of clues was so nice, and they did very nice for us. For example, when I asked them to change the flavor of Häagen- Dazs (provided after meal). They changed with beautiful smile. What's more, the cost of the tickets was very cheap like 200 dallors. I thing I expext them is that upgrade meal in the flight and the space for foot. But the other things were really nice. I really recommend this airline to people who wants to receive fantastic service by paying less money.

title: Rude Airline Office Staff
review: My little brother had to reach Hong Kong by Saturday November 18 night 10PM to join his ship vessel ( he is a fresh sailor just graduated from Maritime university) so he took early morning 1 AM flight from Yangon International airport. The flight got cancelled due to technical error which is totally understandable but the airline office staff kept the passengers wait more than 10 Hrs. When I called the office staff and request to arrange something for my brother as it is his first career trip and I got horrible response from one office staff who hold this number 09421128232, she yelled at me and say " Go to hell if you can't wait". And finally my brother couldn't get the flight and had to cancelled his trip. This is a huge career loss. And no customers should get a rude response from the airline staff. Cathy Dragon airway should take a serious investigation before hiring someone. Airline staffs are expected to be good at public communication. I will never travel with Cathy Dragon and also I will share this morning experience to my friends.

title: Vietnam Adventure - connections from Hong Kong to Da Nang, Vietnam
review: The A320 aircraft were clean and bright with standard economy class legroom. The inflight crews were as smiley and helpful as their Cathay counterparts. Impressively there was full meal service on the 1.5-hour flights and despite 100% load factor they pulled off the service without seeming to rush. Our return to Hong Kong was delayed about 45-minutes, but as I was connecting to atrans-Pacific Business Class flight Cathay Dragon provided an invite to the CIP Premium Lounge which was a nice touch. the lounge is pretty basic; comfy seating and good beverages, but the food offerings were mediocre.

title: Credit deserved - Frontline Staff
review: It was a combined flight of Dragon Air and CX from HK to Taipei. It was about 30 minutes delayed but we were well informed. The short flight was plesant and comfortable. On line check-in in HK was OK but it took us an hour for on-line check-in in Taipei to confirm flight and seat from Taipei to HK. This needs immediate remedy to keep CX reputation. The return flight was comfortable because there were quite a number of empty seats. Front line staff were courteous and pleasant as usual. So far, last 12 months I have flown via CX 12 times and I myself was quite satisfied with CX's frontline staff. Problems of CX group is obvious, its senior management has performed poorly and failed to reach the skill level in management.

title: Decent Airline
review: Had a flight from Hong Kong to Hangzhou and it was a decent flight. The crew was very nice and friendly. They also served a nice breakfast on a flight under 2 hours. Not a bad airline for the price. Only down part was the lack of onboard entertainment.

title: Service
review: Decent service on a 4 hour flight from HKG to KUL. I had flow Dragonair in the past but only on short (< one hour) flights and was pleased with the service. The boarding at HKG went smoothly as there are different lines for Elites and economy and board accordingly. This allowed me to board first and have overhead space in my exit row seat with no floor storage. Now seamlessly part of Cathay it seems the service standard has dipped a little. However compared to U.S. legacy carriers this is great service. FA helps people stow luggage, drink/meal service started 15 minutes into flight and tray removal was prompt (great if you want to sleep without a tray in your lap). Food quality out of HKG is still good. IFE is kind of clunky on these aged A330's - sound quality and static noise, and the interiors could use a refresh. Service standard is still good on this airline - friendly, helpful FA's, toilets policed regularly, efficient meal service. All in all a decent experience.

Forgot even talking about the ground staff at Guangzhou as you shouldn't even expect anything....but as we were delayed and I was concerned about my connection, the crew were kind, attentive and even were able to explain alternatives if I would have missed my connect. Honestly, Cathay Dragon service is far more superior to Cathay Pacific....everytime!!!

title: Never again
review: would i fly Cathay Dragon again? I don't think so --- I'm used to budget airlines and not particularly choosy on short hauls, but this was ridiculous. What annoyed me most is that they refused to even look at allocating our seats together as a family citing "the plan is completely full" both before check in, at check in, and at the gate. Turned out, row after row was empty on the flight; probably only about 70% full. Lift your game, Dragon, your mother company is a decent airline!

title: Value

title: BEWARE OF CATHAY DRAGON
review: We flew what I thought was Cathay Pacific to Bangkok. Of course we transited through Hong Kong. When we entered the plane, I was shocked to see how small and close the seats are and how little cushioning there was on the seats. Literally I at 5ft 5inches could not actually sit straight in my seat as my knees were pushing the seat in front of me foward by a good margin. If anyone put their seat back, they were so close I could have kissed them on the mouth. The flight was nothing short of misery and I must say I dreaded the thought of the return flight. Fortunately in Hong Kong we changed planes were at last on a true Cathay Pacific airliner and I must say it was an excellent flight as Cathay Pacific is known for. I have flown Dragon Air before and the craft was very adequate, however, Cathay Dragon is another experience altogether. Be careful when booking not to book a Cathay Dragon Flight.. When they. comment that the comfort of the passenger is their greatest concern my party spontateously laughed out loud as nothing could be more clearly untrue. I use to think Hainan air was the worst airline in the air but now they have an equal in Cathay Dragon Air. I fly no less than 10 international flights a year and most all of them in economy and find most airlines as comfortable as can be expected. I seldom complain but this trip through Asia proved to be among the worst I have experienced regarding air travel. Somnething has gone terribly wrong.

title: Regret to see the standard of service declining
review: Frequent travelers must be quite aware of this notorious route with many long delays caused by air traffic control. My recent experience was being stranded for 13 hours at the airport in Hong Kong and arriving in my hotel room at 6AM the next day. While I acknowlege this reality which is out of the control of the airline, I still think the airline can do better to manage this situation. the main area which can be improved is how they communicate with the passengers. As the airline operates many flights daily on this route, they were not even able to provide a simple and clear announcement on the exact situation so that we can make plan as to whether to wait or make alternative plans such as cancelling the trip as the long delay would cause massive disruption to the original plan. Even when the ban was lifted, the flights do not take off according to the original sequence which, with the lack of information, raise people's anxiety even further. Sadly, I noticed an attitude of indifference of the ground crew as they seem to have got so used to such delay and not realizing that the passengers still look to them for help.

I only request that they procure the proper Bariatric equipment for transporting wheel chair passengers at the destinations. Shortly after taking off, they started serving the meal and I was amazed by the quality of the food and beverage. Although the first class seat itself is just the same as the longhual business class of their sister airline Cathay Pacific, I always find that both the service and the inflight meal quality of Cathay Dragon are better. No matter what, Cathay Dragon is always my first choice regardless of the class I am travelling.

title: The worst service - Cathay playing their customers!!!
review: I had a terrible and unpleasant experience on June 3rd on the flight from Hong Kong to Kaohsiung. On that day, I flew from Europe. Compared with the service provided by the European flight on that day, I may give 1 on the scale of 10 to Cathay. At least, Cathay did not cancel the flight, did not kick me out of the aircraft, and finally flew to Kaohsiung after a 4-hour delay. Thus, I gave 1. During this period, every half an hour, we heard the broadcast from the Captain – saying that our flight would be ready for departure in 20 mins. So we had much such broadcasting in four hours. Don’t you think Cathay was playing a trick on its customers? The funny thing is that the first Captain maybe could not tolerate such a long-time delay as well, and he left, and another Captain took the place.

The staff were courteous and cheerful, the food was quite tolerable, and the aircraft interiors comfortable enough for the four hours to Hong Kong. Flights were punctual and landings gentle. title: Would fly again

DOWNLOAD STUDIO KA APP so you can join inflight network and access inflight entertainment system which included Chinese and Western hits and was quite pleasing. Cabin crew were friendly and fast with no complaints. After a smooth flight we touched down about 5 minutes late, with English and Australian pilots flying. With last row being last off it was slightly inconvenient but not much can be done about that. A very good flight otherwise, would recommend.

title: Good flight from HKG to Siem Reap but bags were delayed.
review: My family and I fly Dragonair to Siem Reap as a connection from our LAX-HKG flight on Cathay Pacific. We had a 2 1/2 hour layover in HKG so there should have been plenty of time for all of our bags to make the connecting flight to Siem Reap but only one of three bags turned up. Since this was the first leg of a 3 week trip to SE Asia I was very worried. However both of the missing bags turned up at our hotel the night of our arrival. Had we not had the baggage problem I would have given them 4*.

title: Why so difficult to make CX-KA seamless?
review: Even after owning Dragonair 100% and even rebranding it as Cathay Dragon, the Swire Group is determined to give customers grief by (1) keeping the check in counters for the two airlines as far away from each other both in the airport n the Kowloon check in (2) make some tickets not interchangeable unless endorsed (3) make me run from gate 68 to gate 23 when there is a gate change on KA906 and I was sitting in the CX lounge during the delay. You enjoy doing this don't you CX!

title: Could not post on cathay site
review: Before I Boarded CX 889 at JFK, i spent a short time in the lounge, CX moved terminal but the lounge is not worse here. In the old lounge you had free alcoholic beverages and in the new lounge you had to purchase. Prices were same as a regular airport bar, guess this is the way they try to save money now. I bought a beer and had a cup of the free soup then I went and waited outside in one of the regular places. Boarded CX 889 to YVR and then on too HKG. I try to take the 889 since I have experienced friendlier crew on this flight compare to the direct flight it's a little bit inconvenient with the stop in YVR but take the opportunity to walk around this first leg on my flight had excellent staff and the food was good, after dinner I slept. Crew change in YVR was quick and the new staff came around with hot towels and then a then drinks and meal. This crew was excellent as well, the inflight manager was a older gentleman and he took the time greeting all passenger even though the flight was full. It's a nice little touch that happen on the YVR flights even if you are not a gold member. After meal I read and relaxed. Walked around the aircraft to prevent DVT a few times during the night saw the inflight manager in the aft pantry and he offered a glass of juice. Had some turbulence over Japan when breakfast was served so had to wait with morning coffee. Arrived in HKG and went to the lounge to freshen up before CX705 to BKK. CX 705 was a A330 and it also had long haul seats which as comfortable. Had breakfast and slept a while, when I woke up I had a blanket which was a nice touch. The crew on CX705 was as excellent as the one on CX889. Have flown around the world for work 30 years and strongly believe that Cathay have the best crew and they make you feel welcome regardless of class you fly. This is something that is lacking on US airlines and even on the other Chinese airlines. It's worth the extra money to fly with Cathay.

title: 作為國泰港龍航空既忠實用戶的確有回報的。
review: 之前所有出行都係搵平機票，的確好多時候睇到比價網站價錢好吸引。但因為一個長期看國泰港龍既朋友同我講，D Asia Miles同Marco Polo Club好見洗，所以我轉左過黎。用左三四個月後，首先發現Cathay同港龍既boarding gate都唔會比其他airline咁遠。而且Marco Polo Club Green Card就已經可以提早同Premium Econ一同登機。然之後喺呢幾個月間都upgrade過我extra leg Room但係無額外收費。而且最近一次飛武漢機票價錢比原訂既平左30%。所以做國泰港龍長期忠誠客戶係有保障的。
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Bring Cathay Pacific back for the HK route
review: I usually fly Cathay Pacific for my business trips to Hong Kong so was a little surprised to know that they no longer fly this route now. I remember being able to pre-select seats during booking even if it was for Economy promo seats, but this is now no longer possible. Imagine having to set a reminder to ensure you do your online check-in on the dot so you get seats that you want. The cabin temperature was really low, however they had run out of blankets when requested. This is a first for me. Never has any other airline that offers blankets as part of their suite of services given me this excuse. The food was bland, the portions tiny. They don’t fly directly into the terminal in Hong Kong. We had to get off way before the terminal and get stuffed into a shuttle bus that takes us to the terminal. This was a royal pain because we had to lug our cabin cases onto the bus. The white wine on the return flight was vile. The air crew were not very friendly. Purchased something on board and it took them ages to return the credit card for signing. I found the crew in question chatting away with another passenger instead. They should know not to hold on to a customer’s card for an extended period of time. The seats were not very comfortable. I fly to Hong Kong for business quite regularly and miss the service I've gotten used to while flying with Cathay Pacific. I want them back for this route!
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Good service
review: Overall experienced good service. Although seat selection at the time of booking was not applicable for my ticket due to "T&C", still Cathay Pacific customer service agent reserved seats for us as traveled with a child. Enjoyed flight entertainment, food and had no issue of leg space.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Delay and unfriendly ground service
review: They expect passengers to queue by business class, premium economy and economy. I wrongly followed majority queue at premium economy. The way ground service look and spoke to me, make me feel so bad like I'm not qualified to get a good service at this price.

title: Budget airline, but not budget price!!
review: Unfortunately Cathay Pacific has stopped flying to Kuala Lumpur over the last 3 months and its flights have been taken over by Cathay Dragon under some sort of re-structuring. I have been a regular flying on this sector for many many years. The difference is SO VERY great. Young air hostesses but very inexperienced and not dedicated. Can always find them resting and chatting to each other in the area for preparing meals. Food - just inedible. 2 return trips over the last 3 weeks and each time the food they served is inedible. Is Cathay Dragon a budget airline? If you want budget airline, may be better to fly Air Asia for the price you pay and buy your own food. The food is better and it may be cheaper in the end. Cathay Dragon fares are not budget airline prices.

title: Avoid CX5397 01:10am from Haneda to Hong Kong at all costs!
review: This is the worst business class flight I had for last 15 years and I fly twice a week so know what I'm talking about. The plane is a A`320. Very small with only 8 business class seats. The seats are actually premium economy not business and they only recline back less than several cms or a few inches. Condition is terrible. Planes are very old. You cannot sleep as no legroom either.Do not fly this flight ever ~ its a classic "bait and switch" by Dragon and Cathay Pacific. You pay business class and they give you rubbish because its 110am in morning..its terrible. They even only have an old ipad as a video ~ its a joke! Flight crew are angry too as their conditions are bad on this flight too! Food is a zero ~ everything on this flight is rubbish!
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Those who opt for Vegetarian meals are a class lower
review: Cathay is a great airline normally, especially when you fly from Hong Kong to Europe or US. The leg from Hong Kong to Bangalore is one that I have now flown a couple of times. The seats are good. Cabin crew not dripping sunshine is polite enough. What irks me is that when we order vegetarian meal, they come and dump the meal on us. Then they start the drink services. Then the others are served. In my many international flights, I have not experienced this attitude of lets get done with these veg people and then start full fledged service. I asked for at least water with my meal and I was told that they would give it. i finished my mostly dry meal (salad, cut fruits, no yoghurt, no water. Then when I had long finished my meals, they gave us drinks. Then as an afterthought an ice cream.

review: I booked the 4-day travel package (round trip flights and hotel) from Expedia. Dragon air was the only option that would not cost you extra bucks with fine takeoff schedules. The flights were alright and kind of comfortable. The meals however, please if you could afford to buy a light meal at the airport just do so, because it's pretty weird. Chicken rolls, ordinary right? But it's served with Chinese pickled vegetables, oh my Jove. Also It was a small plane so no telly installed and the wifi didn't allow me to download the studio KA app. It wasn't a big deal as it was a really short journey, but if you have nothing to kill time it would be a pity. Download the app before boarding.

title: Flying Hong Kong by Cathay Dragonair
review: Its only direct flight from Kolkata to Hong Kong for 4 hours duration. Mostly used aircraft is A320. Nicely customized aircraft for CCU-HKG flying with many many instructions written in Chinese- English- Hindi- Bengali. Please remember to book vegetarian food before boarding else you may not get on board food as generally they serves non-vegetarian food. Unfortunately due to some technical error our flight cancelled on that day and delayed by 25 hours and after repairing it fled on next scheduled day. For this they have arranged hotel for night stay and pick up and drop and also compensated with $50 Dragonair vouchers. I was connecting to Macau, also they have arranged ticket for ferry. Overall it was a memorable experience and suggested if flying to Hong Kong then Cathay Dragonair is most preferable airline.

title: Dragonair a pleasant flight experience
review: This airline (in my opinion) is a notch up from Cathay Pacific in more ways than one. Service on board is excellent, fast, friendly and efficient. No task or request is too much or too arduous for the ever smiling attendants. The cabin space is comfortable when considering these are short flights and is also somewhat more bright and airy than the bigger carrier Cathay Pacific. I had previously travelled with this airline (2014) and all the takeoffs, landings and flights (here, I guess, good weather also helps) were smooth and seamless. One complaint, my sister suffered air sickness, were given several paper bags for this purpose and unfortunately was told to store under the seat by an attendant which was unacceptable as it seemed they did not want to handle it despite the fact it was properly sealed after use. Anyway, I wish they were a long haul carrier - it would certainly be my airline of choice.

title: If you thought Cathay were bad -
review: Then wait til you get a load of their budget arm. I generally don't review bad experiences, everybody has off days and I don't think posting negatively about a business is a thing you should take lightly. However for this airline I will make an exception. This is the 3rd year running we have used them to fly to da nang in Vietnam largely because there really hasn't been any competition by other direct flights until recently. Last year they overbooked the flight and as a consequence decided to split my wife and I up even though we were travelling with an infant. When I complained at check in that this wasn't the most sensible plan and perhaps they could split up another group that wasn't travelling with a child all I achieved was a 45 minute delay checking in and an embarrassing conversation at the gate where I had been told my seats would be reassigned. The person at the gate had no idea what I was talking about and we ended up rows apart as we would have done in the first place. As I said above everyone has off days but this year I decided to reserve my seats to avoid any issues as we were travelling with a 2 children, one toddler and one 6 month old. I bought and paid for the flights 8 months in advance and chose seats as close to the front of the plane as I could to make boarding and departing as easy as possible. These happened to be the very front row, number 10, which was perfect as that was the only row with a baby bassinet. I looked at the seat configuration on line and discovered in rows 10-13 they were 2+2, then the next row was 22 and everything back of here was 3+3. I called the airline to ask about this and whether these were business class seats as I explained to them I would happily pay for business class were they to offer it on this route but they assured me they did not and confirmed I had reserved seats in row 10. About 6 weeks later by pure chance I noticed in the 'my bookings section' of the Marco Polo club website that my seats were now showing as row 26. I called the Marco Polo club, at the time I was a silver tier member, they couldn't offer me any explanation as to why my seats had been reassigned but changed them back and confirmed by email that we were in row 10 once more. The day before our flight I received a missed call and voicemail message from an unknown number. The voicemail was largely inaudible but I made out the words 'dragonair' so I gave them a call. I was informed they had to switch aeroplanes and due to a different seat configuration I would no longer be in a row with a baby bassinet. I asked what row they had moved me to and I was informed 46. I asked why I wasn't just assigned the corresponding seats on the new aircraft as they could see I had 2 children one of whom is a babe in arms but they blamed the airport and said it was out of their hands. 2 hours of complaining later I was told by a manager We had seats all together in row 26, 4 rows back from the front of the plane. Grovelling apologies were offered and I accepted that aircraft need to be changed and they had done their best to accommodate me. Next morning at check in we were handed boarding passes for row 38. I admit at this point I lost my temper, especially when I was told that basically despite the 2 hour phone call, the 3 separate confirmations of a confirmed seat and the assurances of a supervisor, we had been bumped backwards because higher tiered club members were being assigned seats at the front and my tier level had by this point slipped back down to green. Another 45 minutes wasted at check in arguing and I gave up. I am a great believer in voting with my feet and that's what I intend to do. The icing on the cake however was to come when we boarded only to discover that they hadn't changed the aircraft, the seating configuration was identical to the one we had originally reserved the seats with the bassinet in and no one in these rows had so much as a teenager with them let alone a baby. Had they told me from the get go that the first 10 rows had priority for higher tiered members and I was likely to be moved I would gladly have accepted a seat in a row where confirmed and reserved mean just that. I also do not appreciate being lied to. I fully encourage anyone travelling to da nang to make up their own minds and please don't let this review discourage you from visiting this wonderful place either.

title: Disappointed Experience
review: The airline sent me reminders to do online check-in and so I did. I was pretty happy to get a good seat and thought that all I have to do is to go to the airport ticket machine and print out the paper ticket as what any passengers would do in Hong Kong Airport. As a matter of fact, Hong Kong do not even need a paper ticket! But since China has not implemented the paperless ticket part and still insist on killing the trees, we have no choice. To my surprise when I arrived at Xiamen Airport, there was a long queue, first at the customs, and then at the check-in counter. I headed for the machines only to find out that the machine only accepts China ID. The staff was nice to tell me that those machines will not work unless you have a China ID. So it is an International flight with International passengers right? So we need a China ID to use the machine even if we had done online check-in? So where is the online check-in queue? NONE! You will have to queue in the regular queue which took 30mins. I do not understand why do they even implement a online check-in (which purpose is to reduce the numbers of people waiting in the queue at the check-in counter)? This is not the last of the problems. The flight was delayed by 2 hours, which caused many passengers onboard to miss their connecting flight in Hong Kong. Dragon is a good airline but once operated in China, I don't think I can give them any good ratings.
scores_cat: Check-in and Boarding (e.g. efficiency, service at gate)

title: Terrible food and service
review: First time on Dragon Air and it was a terrible experience after the super service that we received on our flight by Cathay Pacific into Hong Kong from Japan. The only saving grace of this airlines is that it has enough legroom and the entertainment is okay. The food sucks bigtime!!!! I don't know who their caterers are but they need to be changed. You just DO NOT give passengers PASTA (Italian) with DAAL FRY and OKHRA FRY (Indian)! Truly what kind of a combo is that. On the way into Hong Kong, we were served with soggy scrambled eggs, sans pepper /salt which was fished out of the hostess's apron pouch on demand and a dry piece of Uthapam. And the hostesses are either trainees who have no clue about service or are just tired unmotivated people. They are associated with Cathay Pacific and that is not good for Cathay Pacific who know how passengers should be treated!

The service was excellent, didn't expect food to be included so the meals were a surprise - and surprisingly good. The free glass of wine also a bonus. To cap it off - both flights left exactly on time and arrived a few minutes early. Would not hesitate to travel with Dragonair again

review: When booking the reservation with Dragonair, you cannot choose seat assignments in advance. You have to wait until 48 hours before departure and try to gets seats through the online check in process. If this fails, you will need to wait until you get to the airport and check in there. By that time, all of the good seats will be taken by those that paid extra and you will be left with very bad seats. This is extremely disappointing. Dragonair needs to change this policy.

The cabin crew were attentive to all passengers, offered food service included in ticket and provided extra comfort to passengers. The flight was smooth, the seats extra comfortable. Overall this airline deserves the highest praise.

title: Best Flight ever! Really Smooth and Relaxed.
review: Best flight ever. I had been on 5hr flight and I should say the most smooth flight I have ever had. I could see the captain actually decided to deviate the route just to avoid turbulence. It was like we wear sailing on a boat over a smooth sea. The flight crews were great, neatly dressed and polite. The thing I could not forget is that I ordered this special meal and they had this greeting hand written my name and a smile =), over all it was a great experience. In-flight entertainment was good.

title: Dragonair Air hostess shoutes at the passenger
review: I travelled by Dragon air just for 4 hours journey from India to Hong Kong. I am writing this on my own experience about the worst service I received from the air hosting staff with my very first experience with Dragon air. When I board the flight I am caring a cabin bag with 6.5 kg. The weight and dimensions of the bag were within the limit of airline rules. As my height is just 5 feet, I was unable to open the luggage compartment over my head above my seat. So I tried to put the luggage to next luggage compartment very next to my seat. The air hostess who was just passing by saw me struggling and offered help to keep the luggage. However, she failed to do so as her height was not also sufficient. Seeing herself incapable of doing the task in the first attempt she got frustrated (maybe she already fought with somebody). She called her fellow colleague to keep the luggage. A new lady came and stepped up the chair and kept the luggage, but after this, she literally shouted at me by making her eyes big, eyebrow stretched and wicked face. She said, ‘this bag is so heavy and with improper dimensions. Next time you fly you better not use this bag’. I really felt bad and low by her behavior and decided to not to travel by Dragon air ever. I have travelled to 5 countries earlier with the same cabin bag and almost every time the staff of other airline helped me with my baggage. The dramatic scene created by Dragon air hostess I could never forget and that’s why decided to not choose it for my air journey.

review: Checked in very quickly and efficiently and went tot he lounge overlooking the departure gate. Saw the plane arrive but for some reason it was one hour after scheduled departure before we were allowed to board. Boarding was chaotic, no reason given for delay and no apologies for the delay. Aircraft was Airbus A300 which was tired and needed a makeover. No IFE as it was a short flight. Meals looked OK but we had eaten in the lounge so did not eat on the plane. Cabin crew were efficient and cleared meal quickly. Airline needs to improve its information to customers regarding delays. Not impressed especially as we had travelled to HK with Cathay Pacific who own Dragonair and provide a much better service

title: Good service and inflight but terrible ground planning
review: I like the airline seats, the cabin, the nice entertaining screens and the food. A333. But what really upsets me was where the plane was parked in PVG. Usually an aircraft with a double aisle would park in gate connected to a bridge. However we followed our gate directions and it lead us to a gate that leads to the TARMAC. I had no idea what going on or so, we hop on a tarmac bus which took us to the plane across the taxiway. I'd prefer to directly use a bridge than a bus.

title: Surprisingly pleasant flight
review: Did not expect much from flying Dragonair these days. It is a fully-owned subsidiary of Cathay Pacific (which is known for cost cutting across all travel classes) and given the recent rebranding to Cathay Dragon, I really was not sure what I was getting into. Cathay can serve a sub-standard meal for a 4-hour flight (like between Hong Kong and Singapore or Hong Kong and Tokyo), but on this flight which departed at 1300, we got a hot lunch with a cabbage salad as appetizer, followed by chicken curry with rice and Chinese cabbage or fish in white sauce with roasted potatoes and green beans / carrots as main. They also served a piece of random cake PLUS Haagen Daaz ice cream, almost a Dragonair trademark. Many have feared that the ice cream offering is gone from their catering (and indeed this is the case with many <3-hour flights to/from Mainland China outside of traditional lunch/dinner hours), but was still surprised to see this item served on a route that is tourist-heavy. The interior of the aircraft, the uniform, the seats, even the entertainment system smell of Cathay, but the crew seemed more proactive and friendly (and genuinely looked like they enjoyed what they were doing) compared to a typical Cathay flight. Was moderately surprised.

title: A comfortable flight with nice flight attendants.
review: We were traveling with a group off 33 people. Dragonair staff was kind and accommodating. We will definitely use Dragonair when available.

title: Wow, ice cream in economy class
review: On time, friendly efficient staff, and premium ice cream topped an excellent chicken pasta lunch on a flight of only about 2 hours. Plane was exceptionally clean and the pilot smoothly stuck the landing in windy conditions.

title: Still good
review: Flying to Shanghai is always a problem. I find Shanghai SHA a better airport for travel to outer cities in the neighbourhood. The only drawback is 1 flight a day. KA need to add fights to here.

title: Good
review: Good. Recommend to book single tickets even for a return ticket trip. The 2 single legs are much much cheaper than the set return fare.

title: V good for China
review: Not a cheap flight but was ideal for my visit into China.

title: One of the better airline in Asia
review: Dragonair is the only airline flying directly from kolkata to hongkong, its one of the best airline because it is managed by Cathay Pacific. The cabin crew is helpful but the ground staffs are too fussy about baggage weight restrictions.Meals and drinks service should be improved as being a vegetarian i had no meals offered.

title: One of the better airline in Southeast Asia
review: This is my second time flying with Dragonair. The seats were comfortable and the cabin crew were friendly. What stood out with the meal was the Haagen Dazs ice cream as dessert. The captain was British I think; there was a short delay, and he kept us updated and was reassuring. The take off was smoothest I've ever experienced.

title: Best domesstic airline
review: Dragonair is far and away the best domestic airline in China, because it is managed by Cathay Pacific. The cabin crew don't always do the right thing, but you know that they are trying. Meals and drinks service are far superior to their competitors. Given a choice for travel within China, few businessmen would go elsewhere. Also, its comforting to know that Dragonair's parent.has one of the world's best safety records.

title: Better than the other airlines!
review: I had flew from Hong Kong to Wenzhou in January 2016, and I am very pleased with this airline. The captains had a very smooth landing, which I haven't encounter in a long time.

title: Only for short flights.
review: This was an Airbus. No leg room and very uncomfortable for a big person. It was hell for 3 hours. Flight were smooth. Food and service were excellent.

title: BUSINESS TRIP
review: Typical flight, average space for a China flight, good "inflight snack", good service, fairly short flight, on time, take off and arrival.

title: A pleasant flight
review: Just a nice, well run airline today. Attractive new A330 with 2-4-2 seating, so half the seats are aisle seats. Good video on demand, slightly above average meal with Hagen Daz ice cream, pleasant crew. Nothing astounding, but the way an airline should be. Also they flew gate to gate, none of those bus rides out onto the tarmac.
